intro: Grisebachianthus, commonly known as the African daisy, is a genus of flowering plants native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other composite flowers. The plants are characterized by their showy, daisy-like flowers with ray florets surrounding a central disk. Grisebachianthus species typically grow in grasslands and open woodlands, thriving in well-drained soils. They are often cultivated for their ornamental value due to their vibrant colors and long-lasting blooms.
